alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 1:55PM MST until September 21 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Paria River in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST Wednesday /1100 PM MDT Wednesday/. * At 151 PM MST /251 PM MDT/, Stream gauge reports indicated flash flooding along the Paria River in extreme southern Utah. This flooding will move southeast along the river into far northern Coconino County, down to the confluence with the Colorado River near Lees Ferry by late this evening. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding in and around the Paria River. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Paria River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lees Ferry, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Grand Canyon National Park. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River and Paria River. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of the Paria River slot canyon! Flood waters will flow down the Paria River, reaching the confluence with the Colorado River at Lees Ferry around 8 to 10 PM.
